thread.title: Peter Capaldi announces he will leave Doctor Who at the end of the year
thread.title_full: Peter Capaldi announces he will leave Doctor Who at the end of the year

author: Anita Singh
title: Peter Capaldi announces he will leave Doctor Who at the end of the year
text:
Peter Capaldi announces he will leave Doctor Who at the end of the year Peter Capaldi has played the Doctor since 2013 Credit: Ray Burmiston /BBC Anita Singh 30 January 2017 • 10:20pm 
D octor Who actor Peter Capaldi has announced that he will step down from the role at the end of the year. 
The Scottish star said he felt it was "time to move on", after taking over from Matt Smith as the Doctor in 2013. 
He made the announcement Jo Whileys BBC Radio 2 show on Monday evening. 
He said: "One of the greatest privileges of being Doctor Who is to see the world at its best. From our brilliant crew and creative team working for the best broadcaster on the planet, to the viewers and fans whose endless creativity, generosity and inclusiveness points to a brighter future ahead. 
"I can’t thank everyone enough. It’s been cosmic." Follow Telegraph News
